events.title: Security Council LIVE: Attacks against Ukrainian civilians unacceptable, unjustifiable and must stop, says UN
events.description: The UN Security Council is meeting in emergency session in New York over Russia’s ongoing deadly missile and drone strikes targeting Ukrainian civilians and energy infrastructure, as frigid winter conditions grip the war-torn country. Millions have been deprived of electricity, heating and water. The UN Secretary-General has called the stepped up attacks an unacceptable violation of international humanitarian law. Follow live below and find all our in-depth meetings coverage here. UN News app users can go here.

events.title: 2025 was the third warmest year on record
events.description: Droughts, hurricanes and wildfires are becoming the new normal. Global temperatures have shattered records for more than a decade.

events.title: Quarter of developing countries poorer than in 2019, World Bank finds
events.description: Global growth ‘downshifted’ since Covid pandemic and sub-Saharan Africa particularly affected, report says Business live – latest updates A quarter of countries in the developing world are poorer than they were in 2019 before the Covid pandemic, the World Bank has found. The Washington-based organisation said a large group of low-income countries, many in sub-Saharan Africa, had suffered a negative shock in the six years to the end of last year. Continue reading...

events.title: In Sudan & Iran, digital shutdown 'masks atrocities against civilians protesting for basic freedoms'
events.description: As Iran’s violent crackdown intensifies, amid unprecedented sociopolitical and economic uprisings nationwide, François Picard welcomes Alp Toker, Director of NetBlocks. Mr. Toker describes a sophisticated campaign by Iranian authorities to block all digital communications, a strategic move to crush dissent and control the national and global narrative. Analysts, journalists, and human rights organizations estimate that the death toll from the regime’s ruthless crackdown could range from 2,000 to upwards of 20,000 Iranian citizens.

events.title: Trump’s other Latin American feud: why Colombia’s Petro is not Maduro
events.description: Leftwing leader rallies his supporters as US president accuses him of drug trafficking and threatens military action A leftwing South American firebrand calls for his followers to rally in public squares nationwide to defend his country’s sovereignty and decry verbal attacks from Donald Trump. The US president accuses the leader of personally flooding American streets with illegal drugs and imposes sanctions against him and his wife. Threats of military action are followed by a phone conversation between the two leaders. One might imagine that this is a description of the buildup of tensions that led to the 3 January special forces raid on Caracas to capture the Venezuelan leader, Nicolás Maduro, and his wife, Cilia Flores, to face several criminal charges in New York. Continue reading...

events.title: At least 22 killed as crane collapses on train in Thailand
events.description: Crane was working on a high-speed rail project when it collapsed and hit the passing train, causing it to derail and briefly catch fire At least 22 people in Thailand have been killed and scores injured after a crane collapsed onto a passenger train, derailing it on Wednesday, officials said. Footage from the scene verified by Agence France-Presse showed the crane’s broken structure resting on giant concrete pillars, with smoke rising from the wreckage of the train below. Continue reading...

events.title: Live: Iran calls for fast trials of protesters despite Trump’s warning
events.description: Iran's judiciary chief on Wednesday called for fast-track trials for detained protesters, despite US President Donald Trump's threat of "very strong action" if the Islamic republic goes ahead with executions. It came as the verified death toll of people killed in a crackdown on protesters passed the 2,000 mark, according to rights groups based outside Iran. Follow our liveblog for all the latest developments.

events.title: Nigeria named epicenter of global killings of Christians over faith in 2025, report says
events.description: Christians killed in Nigeria reaches alarming levels as Open Doors reports 3,490 of 4,849 Christians murdered worldwide for their faith occurred in Nigeria.

events.title: No power or water and -19C: Kyiv seeks relief from Russian strikes and cold
events.description: Residents of Ukraine's capital talk about their difficulties keeping warm and enduring power outages, as Russian attacks deepen the energy crisis.

events.title: New clashes between Syrian army and Kurdish forces erupt east of Aleppo
events.description: Clashes between Syrian government troops and the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) erupted Tuesday in the Deir Hafer district of Aleppo province. It came days after the evacuation of SDF fighters from Aleppo's Kurdish-majority Sheikh Maqsud and Achrafieh neighbourhoods. No casualties were immediately reported, but the clashes could mark an escalation of conflict in northern Syria.

events.title: World News in Brief: Ending famine, refugee solidarity in Kenya, Ukraine civilian casualties update
events.description: The head of the UN’s emergency food agency has urged world leaders on Monday to end “man-made famines” and conflicts that “drive hunger and desperation”.

events.title: Crane collapse causes deadly train crash in Thailand
events.description: At least 29 people were killed and dozens injured after a construction crane collapsed onto a train in Thailand.

events.title: Minnesota: Prosecutors reportedly resign over federal probe
events.description: Several state prosecutors have reportedly resigned over the lack of a civil rights investigation into the fatal shooting of a woman in Minneapolis by an ICE agent. The US Justice Department denies the two are linked.

events.title: Two weeks on, questions linger over targeting and impact of US airstrikes in Nigeria
events.description: Very little information has been shared about strikes in Sokoto state Two weeks after the US carried out Christmas Day airstrikes in north-west Nigeria on what it described as Islamic State fighters, questions remain over the specific group that was targeted and the operation’s impact. In the aftermath of the strikes, Donald Trump said in a post on his Truth Social platform that “ISIS Terrorist Scum in Northwest Nigeria , who have been targeting and viciously killing, primarily, innocent Christians” were hit with “numerous perfect strikes”. Continue reading...

events.title: US plan to exploit Venezuela’s oil could eat up 13% of carbon budget to keep 1.5C limit
events.description: Exclusive: ClimatePartner analysis shows how move would risk plunging Earth further into climate catastrophe US plans to exploit Venezuela’s oil reserves could by 2050 consume more than a tenth of the world’s remaining carbon budget to limit global heating to 1.5C, according to an exclusive analysis. The calculation highlights how any moves to further exploit the South American nation’s oil reserves – the largest in the world, at least on paper – would put increasing pressure on climate goals, and risk plunging the Earth further into climate catastrophe. Continue reading...

events.title: Suspected Venezuelan gangster in Portland CBP attack tied to shooting at apartment complex: police
events.description: An alleged Venezuelan gang member's wife was linked to an earlier shooting before a federal confrontation that left both suspects wounded during a Portland traffic stop.

events.title: Minns says bridge used in Bondi attack should be torn down – as it happened
events.description: This blog is now closed Senior Liberals urge colleagues to vote against Labor’s hate speech and gun laws in wake of Bondi terror attack Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Bridget McKenzie concerned there’s not enough time to work through hate speech and gun reform legislation Bridget McKenzie , the shadow minister for infrastructure, said she is concerned there is not enough time to work through upcoming legislation on hate speech and gun reforms after the Bondi terror attack. Those pieces of legislation were subjected to long and lengthy and appropriate scrutiny by the parliament, by the broader community, by the experts, so that we, as a parliament, could get it right … Unfortunately, the prime minister has chosen to play politics with this bill. He’s lumped migration changes in with the management of firearms and obviously in with hate speech laws. So there’s a lot to unpack and not enough time before we debate it to actually get those opinions from the experts. It was right and appropriate that we as an opposition seek to work with the government to call a royal commission to actually bring parliament back to move motions of condolence and support for our, particularly our Jewish community … But when it comes to a piece of legislation, that should go through the appropriate processes of parliament so that we can get it right. Continue reading...

events.title: US launches wave of strikes in Somalia targeting ISIS, al-Shabab terror threats
events.description: U.S. Africa Command General Michael E. Langley warns of jihadi threat to homeland as airstrikes against al-Shabab and ISIS-Somalia intensify under Trump administration.

events.title: Trump praises 'low' inflation data, doubles down on rate cut demands
events.description: US President Donald Trump says inflation in the country is low enough for Fed chair Jerome Powell to deliver "a big, beautiful cut" to interest rates. US consumer prices rose 2.7% in December, still significantly above the Federal Reserve's 2% target. Meanwhile, the heads of global central banks come together in support of Powell, after the Justice Department's criminal investigation against him raised concerns over the Fed's independence.

events.title: 2025 was third hottest year on record, climate experts see no relief in 2026
events.description: The world recorded its third-hottest year on record in 2025, extending an unprecedented streak of global heat with no relief expected in 2026, US and EU climate scientists said on Wednesday. The past 11 years were the warmest on record, with temperatures exceeding 1.5 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels on average.

events.title: ‘A torture that never stops’: Sri Lanka failing survivors of conflict sexual violence, UN says
events.description: Conflict-related sexual violence in Sri Lanka remains largely unaddressed more than 15 years after the end of the civil war, with survivors still denied justice, recognition and reparations, according to a new report by the UN human rights office, OHCHR, on Tuesday.

events.title: Trump administration ends temporary protected status for Somalis in US
events.description: Critics condemn ‘bigoted attack’ as Trump bids to revoke citizenship of naturalized immigrants convicted of fraud The Trump administration is terminating temporary protected status (TPS) for Somalis living in the United States, giving hundreds of people two months to leave the country or face deportation. The homeland security secretary, Kristi Noem , said in a statement that conditions in the east African country had improved sufficiently and that Somalis no longer qualified for the designation under federal law. Continue reading...

events.title: Carney heads to Beijing as Trump’s America First agenda forces Canada into trade rethink
events.description: Canada’s PM seeks to smooth over past ructions in relationship with China as trade war takes its toll During the final stretch of Canada’s spring election campaign, Mark Carney told a debate audience that China was the country’s “biggest geopolitical risk”. He pointed to its attempts to meddle in elections and its recent efforts to disrupt Canada’s Arctic claims. When Carney’s government plane touches down in Beijing this week, it will be the first time a Canadian prime minister has been welcomed in nearly a decade. The trip, undertaken amid the rupturing of global economic and political alliances , reflects a desire by Ottawa to mend a broken relationship with a global superpower that uses its vast and lucrative market to both woo and punish countries. Continue reading...

events.title: Gaza: A ceasefire that still kills children is not enough, says UNICEF
events.description: Airstrikes, drone attacks and hypothermia continue in Gaza despite the ceasefire, with more than 100 youngsters killed since early October, the UN Children’s Fund (UNICEF) said on Tuesday.

events.title: Gaza: Storms worsen already dire humanitarian situation, UN warns
events.description: The humanitarian crisis across the Gaza Strip remains extremely serious, with harsh winter weather threatening to reverse recent gains in aid delivery, the United Nations said on Monday.

events.title: UN chief ‘shocked’ by reports of excessive force against protesters in Iran
events.description: The UN Secretary-General is shocked by reports of violence and excessive use of force by Iranian authorities against protesters across the country, urging restraint and the immediate restoration of communications as unrest enters its third week.

events.title: Sudan war leaves millions hungry and displaced as health system nears collapse
events.description: Sudan’s protracted conflict has spiralled into one of the world’s most severe humanitarian crises, with hunger, displacement and the collapse of basic services exacting a daily toll on civilians.

events.title: Myanmar says Rohingya genocide case at world court is 'flawed and unfounded'
events.description: Myanmar’s foreign ministry said on Wednesday that a genocide case at the International Court of Justice over its treatment of the mostly Muslim Rohingya minority was “flawed and unfounded”. The court began three weeks of hearings on Monday on allegations brought by The Gambia over a 2017 military crackdown.

events.title: South Korean prosecutors demand death penalty for ex-leader Yoon
events.description: South Korean prosecutors called on Tuesday for the death penalty to be handed down to former president Yoon Suk Yeol for his December 2024 declaration of martial law, which plunged the country into chaos. Yoon triggered a political crisis when he announced an end to civilian rule in December 2024 and sent troops to parliament to enforce it. FRANCE 24's Monte Francis reports.

events.title: UN World Court begins landmark hearings on Rohingya genocide case against Myanmar
events.description: Public hearings opened on Monday at the International Court of Justice (ICJ) in a landmark case brought by the Gambia against Myanmar, alleging violations of the Genocide Convention over the military’s treatment of the Rohingya minority.

events.title: Tyler Robinson prosecutors say Charlie Kirk shooting texts show confusion, not bias, to rebut conflict claim
events.description: Accused Charlie Kirk assassin Tyler Robinson seeks to disqualify prosecutor whose child witnessed the fatal shooting at Utah Valley University campus.

events.title: Multiple people killed after construction crane falls, derails train in Thailand
events.description: A deadly construction accident unfolded in northeastern Thailand when a crane collapsed onto a moving passenger train, officials said.

events.title: Attempt to overturn the Gambia’s ban on FGM heard by supreme court
events.description: Case brought by Muslim leaders and MP follows failed 2024 bid and seen as part of global anti-women’s rights backlash A group of religious leaders and an MP in the Gambia have launched efforts to overturn a ban on female genital mutilation at the country’s supreme court. The court case, due to resume this month, comes after two babies bled to death after undergoing FGM in the Gambia last year. Almameh Gibba, an MP and one of the plaintiffs, tabled a bill to decriminalise FGM that was rejected by the country’s parliament in 2024. Continue reading...

events.title: Australia exposed Iranian asylum seeker to torture on Manus, UN says
events.description: United Nations says man experienced ‘serious violence’ in detention but Australia argues it did not control PNG facilities Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Australia exposed an Iranian asylum seeker to torture and ill-treatment during his years in detention, a UN committee has found, amounting to a breach of international obligations. On Wednesday evening, the UN committee against its torture released its decision on the case of an asylum seeker who arrived on Christmas Island by boat in 2013 after fleeing Iran in fear of persecution. Continue reading...

events.title: Iran updates: Tehran warns of fast trials, executions
events.description: The leader of Iran's judiciary has said there will be rapid trials and executions for those arrested in nationwide protests. Washington has threatened military action over the crackdown. DW has the latest.

events.title: Iran protests death toll tops 2,000, activists say, in worst upheaval since 1979 revolution
events.description: US-based activists said the death toll in the Iranian government's crackdown on the largest protest movement since the 1979 revolution had passed 2,000. While an enduring internet blackout has made it impossible to know the full scale of the violence, some Iranians have been able to report what they've seen via phone calls.

events.title: What to know about the Muslim Brotherhood after the US terrorist designation
events.description: The Trump administration has designated the Lebanese, Jordanian and Egyptian chapters of the Muslim Brotherhood as terrorist organizations

events.title: World News in Brief: Escalating fighting in Sudan, displacement in Syria’s Aleppo, $1.5 billion appeal for South Sudan
events.description: More civilians in Sudan continue to be killed and displaced as fighting escalates in multiple parts of the country, the UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) said on Tuesday.

events.title: Iran: ‘The killing of peaceful demonstrators must stop,’ UN rights chief says
events.description: As anti-government demonstrations continue across Iran, the UN human rights chief said on Tuesday that he was horrified at the mounting violence directed by security forces against protestors, with reports of hundreds killed and thousands arrested.

events.title: Iran regime opened fire with live ammunition on protesters, doctor says: ‘Shoot-to-kill’
events.description: Iranian protests that began Dec. 28 saw security forces shift to live ammunition by Jan. 8, with over 3,000 deaths estimated nationwide.

events.title: Trump admin labels Muslim Brotherhood branches as terrorist organizations
events.description: The U.S. designates the Lebanese, Jordanian and Egyptian chapters of the Muslim Brotherhood as terrorist organizations, saying they pose risks to the U.S.

events.title: Verifying protests and deaths in Iran - amid brutal crackdown and internet shutdown
events.description: Footage posted today on social media shows protesters gathered on the streets of the city of Marvdasht in the southern Iranian Fars province, as a fire burns in the background.

events.title: Beirut's Commodore Hotel, a haven for journalists during Lebanon's civil war, shuts down
events.description: Beirut’s Commodore Hotel, once a hub for foreign journalists during Lebanon’s civil war, has closed amid the country’s economic crisis

events.title: Ukraine war: UN appeals for $2.3 billion to support aid teams’ ‘heroic work’
events.description: Amid ongoing and intensifying Russian attacks across Ukraine, the UN on Tuesday launched a $2.3 billion humanitarian appeal for 2026 to support 4.1 million of the country’s most vulnerable people.

events.title: Ukraine: Deadly Russian strikes push civilians deeper into winter crisis
events.description: Ukraine has entered the new year under intensifying and deadly Russian attacks which have crippled energy systems and left millions without heating, electricity or water amid freezing temperatures, senior UN officials told the Security Council on Monday.

events.title: Germany: Gelsenkirchen bank thieves used 'manipulated' door
events.description: Police say a manipulated emergency exit, that shouldn't open from the outside, gave thieves access in last month's major bank heist in Gelsenkirchen. They warned customers that investigations would likely take months.

events.title: China pressing European countries to bar Taiwan politicians or face crossing a ‘red line’
events.description: Exclusive: Chinese officials are using a ‘highly specific’ interpretation of EU rules to suggest Taiwanese figures should not be granted visas, officials say Chinese officials have been pushing “legal advice” on European countries, saying their own border laws require them to ban entry to Taiwanese politicians, according to more than half a dozen diplomats and officials familiar with the matter. The officials made demarches to European embassies in Beijing, or through local embassies directly to European governments in their capital cities, warning the European countries not to “trample on China’s red lines”, according to the European diplomats and ministries who spoke to the Guardian. Continue reading...

events.title: Senior Liberals urge colleagues to vote against Labor’s hate speech and gun laws in wake of Bondi terror attack
events.description: It comes after opposition leader Sussan Ley has spent weeks calling for better legislative protections to tackle antisemitism Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast The Coalition is set to vote against Labor’s fast-tracked legislation introduced in the wake of the Bondi terror attack, despite opposition leader Sussan Ley calling for urgent legislative action for weeks. Labor would be forced to rely on support from the Greens if the opposition does not support the bill next Tuesday , as Ley flagged reservations about the bill’s drafting and the inability of public servants to explain key provisions on hate speech and religious protection. Continue reading...

events.title: Four people killed in Gaza after walls collapse on tents during strong winds - health officials
events.description: Four people have been killed in Gaza after walls collapsed on to tents during strong winds and rainfall, hospital authorities have said.

events.title: Iranians able to make some international calls as internet remains blocked amid protests
events.description: Iranians could make phone calls abroad after a communications blackout during a crackdown on anti-regime protests, but internet and text messaging remain restricted.

events.title: Iran at geopolitical crossroads as protests pressure regime
events.description: The Islamic Republic is a key player in the Middle East, with close ties to Russia and China. As the regime in Tehran comes under fire, DW looks at Iran's place on the global stage.

events.title: Fact-finding mission urges Iran to end protest violence and restore internet
events.description: The UN-mandated independent human rights fact-finding mission on Iran has urged authorities to immediately restore internet access and halt the violent crackdown of the ongoing, nationwide protest.

events.title: Iran state TV acknowledges 'a lot of martyrs' as death toll surpasses 3,000: report
events.description: Iran state TV reportedly acknowledges 'martyrs' as death toll from ongoing anti-government protests reaches over 2,000, according to activist groups.

events.title: Global temperatures dipped in 2025 but more heat records on way, scientists warn
events.description: The last three years were Earth's hottest on record, as humanity's carbon emissions continue to heat the planet.

events.title: 'Now there's the threat of executions' in Iran
events.description: An Iranian security official says 2,000 people have been killed so far after a crackdown on weeks of anti-government protests.

events.title: Trump continues to threaten military action against Iran
events.description: Amid a deadly crackdown on protesters in Iran, President Trump continues to threaten military action against Tehran and warned countries that do business with Iran that he could impose a tariff.

events.title: At least 27 dead after crane falls on to train in Thailand
events.description: At least 27 people have been killed after a construction crane fell on top of a moving train in northeast Thailand, an official from the State Railway of Thailand told Sky News.

events.title: Increase taxes on sugary drinks and alcohol to save lives, urges WHO
events.description: Beverages like sugary drinks and alcohol are too accessible and cost too little in most of the world – helping fuel obesity, diabetes, cancer and injury, the World Health Organization (WHO) warned on Tuesday.

events.title: At the heart of change: Spotlight Initiative highlights breakthroughs in tackling gender-based violence
events.description: When it comes to protecting women and girls from gender-based violence, change happens when they are “at the heart of every decision,” according to Erin Kenny, Global Coordinator of the Spotlight Initiative a United Nations–European Union partnership aimed at tackling all forms of abuse against women and girls.

events.title: Florida sheriff Grady Judd fires off warning to gangsters after 'Sex, Money, Murder' kingpin taken down
events.description: Gang leader Hernando Thompson convicted on 17 felony counts including racketeering, faces up to five life sentences in Florida "Sex, Money, Murder" case.

events.title: ‘My leg went to heaven before me’: Israeli war extinguishes Gaza childhoods
events.description: After more than two years of a genocidal war, wounded and traumatised Palestinian children stare at an uncertain future.

events.title: A construction crane falls onto a moving train in Thailand, killing at least 29 people
events.description: A construction crane fell onto a moving passenger train, causing a fiery derailment that killed at least 29 people Wednesday in northeastern Thailand. Another 64 people were injured.

events.title: Iranian ambassador summoned over country's response to protests
events.description: Yvette Cooper has confirmed the government has summoned the Iranian ambassador in a statement to the Commons.

events.title: Landslide in eastern Congo kills at least 13, leaves over 30 missing
events.description: A landslide in eastern Congo has killed at least 13 people and left over 30 missing

events.title: Bowen: Authoritarian regimes die gradually then suddenly, but Iran is not there yet
events.description: The regime's opponents will hope for more pressure to accelerate the process, writes the BBC's international editor.

events.title: Myanmar says Rohingya genocide case at The Hague is ‘flawed, unfounded’
events.description: International Court of Justice is deciding if Myanmar committed genocide against Rohingya in a 2017 military crackdown.

events.title: They bought an abandoned 'ghost house' in the Japanese countryside
events.description: He'd spent years backpacking around the world, and Japanese traveler Daisuke Kajiyama was finally ready to return home to pursue his long-held dream of opening up a guesthouse.

events.title: South Korean prosecutors demand death penalty for former president Yoon Suk Yeol
events.description: Yoon is on trial for insurrection charges, after trying to declare martial law in late 2024 South Korean prosecutors have demanded the death penalty for former president Yoon Suk Yeol over his failed martial law declaration in December 2024, in the first insurrection trial of a Korean head of state in three decades. Prosecutors characterised the case as the “serious destruction of constitutional order by anti-state forces”, telling Seoul central district court that Yoon had “directly and fundamentally infringed upon the safety of the state and the survival and freedom of the people”. Continue reading...

events.title: UN International Court of Justice to hear 1st genocide case in over a decade
events.description: The United Nations International Court of Justice is hearing a genocide case for the first time in more than a decade. The case is focused on the persecution of Rohingya Muslims in Myanmar.

events.title: Dozens of people killed in ferry boat accident in northern Mali
events.description: Residents and local officials in northern Mali say a ferry boat trying to land at a Niger River town in the Timbuktu region hit stones and sank in an accident that left dozens of people dead

events.title: What the US withdrawal from UN bodies could mean for climate, trade and development
events.description: The United States’ intention to withdraw from a host of UN bodies announced this week targets programmes and initiatives focusing on a wide range of crucial areas, including the climate crisis, trade, gender and development.

events.title: Fireworks-wielding agitators clash with federal agents outside Minneapolis federal building
events.description: Federal agents deployed tear gas and rubber bullets against Minneapolis protesters after snowballs were allegedly thrown at vehicles, authorities said.

events.title: Trump admin exit from UN, international organizations raises question of who’s next
events.description: U.S. officials say more international organizations could face future cuts after withdrawing from 66 groups, with U.N. agencies potentially targeted next.

events.title: World central bank chiefs 'stand in solidarity' with US Fed chair Powell
events.description: Eleven central banks have backed Jerome Powell after the US launched a criminal investigation into the US Fed.

events.title: Workers at Chinese factory that produces Labubu toys are being exploited, says NGO
events.description: Exclusive: China Labor Watch says people aged 16-18 employed without required special protections A labour rights NGO says it has found evidence of worker exploitation in the supply chain of Labubus, the furry toys that took the world by storm last year and which are expected to continue to grow in popularity in 2026. Labubus, toothy gremlins made by the Chinese toy company Pop Mart, have become one of China’s hottest cultural exports. In the first half of 2025 alone, “the Monsters” line of toys, which includes Labubus, generated 4.8bn yuan (£511m) in sales for the Hong Kong-listed company. In August, Pop Mart’s chief executive, Wang Ning, said the company was on track to reach 20bn yuan in revenues in 2025. Continue reading...

events.title: Thailand: Dozens die as crane falls on passenger train
events.description: The train was travelling from Bangkok to northeast Thailand. At least 29 people have been killed in the accident.

events.title: Can EU exert more pressure on Iran with sanctions?
events.description: The European Union is contemplating more sanctions against Iran amid a deadly crackdown on anti-government protests that has killed thousands. But could the bloc apply more pressure on the Islamic Republic's regime?

events.title: Germany news: 2 men charged with planning attacks for Russia
events.description: Two Ukrainians have been accused of planning sabotage attacks for Russian spy services. Meanwhile, Germany's foreign minister has played down the US threat to Greenland.

events.title: Kazakhstan oil output plunges as Ukrainian drones strike Russia
events.description: Kyiv's attacks on Russian oil terminals and refineries may damage their enemy, but they are also having an impact on other economies such as Kazakhstan's and risk alienating allies.

events.title: 'We choose Denmark' over the US, Greenland’s PM says
events.description: Greenlandic Prime Minister Jens-Frederik Nielsen said the Arctic territory was facing a "geopolitical crisis" as Trump threatens to take it over. Denmark's Mette Frederiksen condemned "unacceptable pressure" from the US.

events.title: Trump to lead largest ever US delegation to Davos
events.description: President Donald Trump will attend the World Economic Forum in Davos next week as head of the largest ever US delegation to attend the annual meeting, including five cabinet members, and a host of congressional representatives and state governors.

events.title: Russian ship captain in court accused of 'grossly negligent' behaviour over North Sea crash
events.description: A Russian ship captain has been accused in court of "grossly negligent conduct" after a fatal collision with an oil tanker near the Humber Estuary last year.

events.title: A sculptor, a teen footballer and a hairdresser: The stories of some of the protesters killed in Iran
events.description: A sculptor, a promising teenage footballer and a hairdresser with tens of thousands of followers on Instagram are among at least 2,000 people killed in two weeks of protests in Iran.

events.title: Woman seen on video allegedly blocking Minnesota ICE operation with car as agitators surround agents
events.description: Video shows woman allegedly blocking ICE agents as Minnesota protests escalate against immigration enforcement. Federal officials report 60 agitators were charged in five days.

events.title: Trump envoy reportedly meets with exiled Iranian prince as regime faces protests
events.description: The Trump administration allegedly made the first high-level contact with the Iranian opposition amid intensifying nationwide anti-regime protests.

events.title: Republican senator condemns alleged Syrian army abuses as ceasefire follows Aleppo fighting
events.description: US Senator demands accountability after alleged human rights violations by Syrian forces against Kurdish civilians in Aleppo amid ongoing conflict.

events.title: Iranian student shot in head at close range amid protests, body buried along roadside
events.description: Iranian student Rubina Aminian was shot in the head at close range, joining thousands allegedly killed by government forces, according to Iran Human Rights, a Norway-based group.

events.title: Cuba’s president defiant, says no negotiations scheduled as Trump moves to choke off oil lifeline
events.description: Cuba rejects Trump's deal demands as Venezuelan oil lifeline ends. President Díaz-Canel says no negotiations with Washington despite energy crisis threats.

events.title: These were the best and worst places for air quality in 2021, new report shows
events.description: Air pollution spiked to unhealthy levels around the world in 2021, according to a new report.

events.title: Craig Silvey’s books pulled from WA and Victoria curriculums after child exploitation material charges
events.description: Sydney stage adaptation and new book put on hold after Runt and Jasper Jones author arrested Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Australian novelist Craig Silvey’s books have been withdrawn from school curriculums in Victoria and his home state, and a major stage adaptation of one of his works has been halted after the author was charged with possessing and distributing child exploitation material this week. Silvey, 43, was arrested on Monday 12 January after detectives executed a search warrant at his Fremantle home. He appeared before the Fremantle magistrates court on Tuesday, charged with distribution of child exploitation material and possession of child exploitation material . No pleas were entered. Continue reading...

events.title: US opens new air defense operations cell at Qatar base that Iran targeted in retaliatory attack
events.description: U.S. opens new air defense cell at Al Udeid Air Base in Qatar amid Iran tensions, enhancing regional missile defense cooperation across Middle East.

events.title: Trump threatens to block ExxonMobil from Venezuela after CEO calls country ‘uninvestable’
events.description: US president says company is ‘playing too cute’ after CEO responds sceptically to his push for oil investment after deposing Nicolás Maduro Donald Trump has said he might block ExxonMobil from investing in Venezuela after the oil company’s chief executive called the country “uninvestable” during a White House meeting last week. Darren Woods told the US president that Venezuela would need to change its laws before it could be an attractive investment opportunity, during the high-profile meeting on Friday with at least 17 other oil executives. Continue reading...

events.title: BTS announces return with new world tour in 2026 and 2027
events.description: K-pop band to start tour in April after nearly four-year hiatus due to all seven members needing to complete South Korea’s mandatory military service The BTS comeback is upon us: the K-pop septet has announced a 2026-2027 world tour, kicking off in South Korea in April and running through to March 2027 with more than 70 dates across Asia, North America, South America, Australia and Europe. The tour marks the group’s first headline performances since their 2021–22 Permission to Dance on Stage tour. 9 April and 11-12 April – Goyang, South Korea 17-18 April – Tokyo 25-26 April – Tampa, Florida 2-3 May – El Paso, Texas 7 May and 9-10 May – Mexico City 16-17 May – Stanford, California 23-24 and 27 May – Las Vegas 12-13 June – Busan, South Korea 26-27 June – Madrid 1-2 July – Brussels 6-7 July – London 11-12 July – Munich 17-18 July – Paris 1-2 Aug – East Rutherford, New Jersey 5-6 Aug – Foxborough, Massachusetts 10-11 Aug – Baltimore 15-16 Aug – Arlington, Texas 22-23 Aug – Toronto 27-28 Aug – Chicago 1-2 Sept and 5-6 Sept – Los Angeles 2-3 Oct – Bogotá, Colombia 9-10 Oct – Lima, Peru 16-17 Oct – Santiago, Chile 23-24 Oct – Buenos Aires, Argentina 28 Oct and 30-31 Oct – São Paulo 19 Nov and 21-22 Nov – Kaohsiung, Taiwan 3 Dec and 5-6 Dec – Bangkok 12-13 Dec – Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia 17 Dec, 19-20 Dec and 22 Dec – Singapore 26-27 Dec – Jakarta 12-13 Feb – Melbourne, Australia 20-21 Feb – Sydney 4 March and 6-7 March – Hong Kong 13-14 March – Manila, Philippines Continue reading...

events.title: Turkish Cypriots: The EU's invisible Europeans
events.description: The unresolved Cyprus problem leaves Turkish Cypriots in a state of limbo within the European Union, without full EU rights, recognition or political certainty and economically and diplomatically isolated.

events.title: Russian investigators launch criminal case after nine babies die at Siberian maternity hospital
events.description: Russian authorities have opened a criminal investigation into a Siberian maternity hospital where nine babies died over the country’s New Year holidays, officials said Tuesday

events.title: 'Welcome to 2976' - North Africa's Amazigh people ring in the new year
events.description: The Amazigh calendar places them almost a thousand years ahead of much of the rest of the world.

events.title: Conditions in Gaza worsen as winds and hypothermia kill 5
events.description: Winter storms kill displaced Palestinians in Gaza left to shelter in flimsy tents by ceasefire abuses.

events.title: The surreal facades of America's strip clubs
events.description: Some people travel the world in search of adventure, while others seek out natural wonders, cultural landmarks or culinary experiences. But French photographer François Prost was looking for something altogether different during his recent road trip across America: strip clubs.

events.title: US frackers were already facing a global oil supply glut. Trump’s Venezuelan dream could make it worse
events.description: Picture is as murky as a barrel of oil, with US companies in 2026 expecting their first production drop in four years US shale-oil producers were already contending with oil prices at four-year lows. News that they may soon face a significant competitor in their back yard probably wasn’t how frackers wanted to greet 2026. The US capture of Venezuela’s President Nicolás Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores, hit the share prices of independent shale-oil producers, such as Diamondback Energy and Devon Energy, last week. Continue reading...

events.title: 'Fly, Wild Swans' is Jung Chang's painfully personal tribute to her mother
events.description: A historian of modern China, Jung Chang turns the lens back on herself in her newest book to understand how she sees the world and why she writes about China today.

events.title: Hundreds in Venezuela come forward to say their loved ones are 'political prisoners'
events.description: Edilson Torres was set to be buried in his hometown after dying in a Venezuelan prison

events.title: Iran protests spark regime survival question as exiled dissident says it feels like a ‘revolution’
events.description: Iran faces unprecedented protests as citizens unite around overthrowing the Islamic Republic, marking the most serious threat to the regime since 1979.

events.title: Only Trump can stop Putin, Polish president tells BBC
events.description: Europe should do everything it can to help the US president in his efforts to end the war in Ukraine, Karol Nawrocki said.

events.title: US approves sale of Nvidia's advanced AI chips to China
events.description: Nvidia has been caught in a tug-of-war between the US and China as the countries compete for AI dominance.

events.title: A crumbling system is depriving India's young offenders of a 'second chance'
events.description: Experts say that children in conflict with the law are being let down by India's juvenile justice system.

events.title: Watch: Timothée Chalamet, Teyana Taylor, Adolescence and other highlights from the Golden Globes
events.description: One Battle After Another and Adolescence swept the Golden Globes as Hollywood's awards season kicks off.

events.title: Scientists confirm 2025 as third-warmest year ever recorded
events.description: Average temperatures during 2023-2025 exceeded the 1.5C limit set out in the Paris Agreement, data shows.

events.title: China’s trade surplus hits new heights in 2025 despite US tariff war
events.description: Trade gap rises to nearly $1.2 trillion as tariffs see exporters pivot to new markets.

events.title: At least 22 people killed when crane falls on train in northeast Thailand
events.description: The train, travelling from Bangkok to northeast Thailand, derails when a construction crane falls on it.

events.title: As hate spirals in India, Hindu extremists turn to Christian targets
events.description: Anti-Muslim violence has soared for more than a decade under Indian PM Modi. Now, Christians face the brunt, too.

events.title: Retail spending fell in March as consumers pull back
events.description: Spending at US retailers fell in March as consumers pulled back amid recessionary fears fueled by the banking crisis.

events.title: Author Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie accuses Lagos hospital of negligence after son’s death
events.description: Lawyers for Adichie and her husband serve Euracare hospital with legal notice after death of 21-month-old The Nigerian author Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie has accused a Lagos hospital of negligence after the death of one of her 21-month-old twin boys. Nkanu Nnamdi died on 6 January after a brief illness. He was one of twin boys born to Adichie and Ivara Esege, a doctor, in 2024 by surrogacy, eight years after the birth of their first child, a girl. Continue reading...

events.title: Apprehension in Denmark ahead of talks about Greenland with Vance
events.description: Leaders from Denmark and Greenland will meet with top U.S. officials in Washington on Wednesday to try to find a way out of a crisis caused by President Trump repeated demands to annex Greenland.

events.title: Iran expert talks about the Trump administration's strategy with Iran
events.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Iran expert Karim Sadjadpour about the U.S. strategy toward Iran and why he believes Iran's regime could collapse.

events.title: Hungary sets April 12 election date as Orbán faces tough challenge
events.description: Hungary's parliamentary election will take place on April 12, with the country’s Prime Minister Viktor Orbán expected to face his toughest challenge in 16 years. FRANCE 24's Monte Francis reports.

events.title: Russia is waging hybrid war on UK and Europe through 'disposable agents'
events.description: Russian spies are increasingly recruiting Ukrainians to carry out acts of sabotage in Europe to undermine NATO and attempt to turn public opinion against Ukraine, according to new research.

events.title: Activists say Iran has aired at least 97 coerced confessions from protesters, often after torture
events.description: Iranian state media has aired at least 97 confessions from protesters since Dec. 28, according to the Human Rights Activists News Agency

events.title: Judge scolds alleged Gilgo Beach killer's defense, vows trial will begin ‘come hell or high water'
events.description: Judge warns alleged Gilgo Beach serial killer Rex Heuermann's lawyers that trial will start after Labor Day "come hell or high water" despite new motions.

events.title: College basketball player gunned down on Nashville freeway, police hunting for suspects
events.description: Tennessee basketball player Andre Bell, 20, was fatally shot on Nashville freeway while returning to Fisk University, police said. Suspect vehicle fled.

events.title: Afghan illegal immigrant who stabbed sister for being 'bad Muslim girl' arrested by ICE agents in New York
events.description: ICE arrested an Afghan illegal immigrant convicted of attempting to murder his teenage sister in 'honor' attack. Called her a 'bad Muslim girl' before stabbing her.

events.title: Ohio dentist double murder: Fmr police chief reveals ‘multitude’ of reasons ex-husband allegedly killed couple
events.description: Former police chief reveals why Ohio dentist's ex-husband allegedly killed couple. Michael McKee charged with murdering Spencer and Monique Tepe.

events.title: South Korean prosecutor seeks death penalty for ex-President Yoon over martial law declaration: 'Self-coup'
events.description: An independent counsel demanded a death sentence for former South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol on rebellion charges over his controversial martial law decree.

events.title: 'We choose Denmark,' says Greenland PM ahead of W. House talks
events.description: Greenland would choose to remain Danish over a US takeover, its leader said Tuesday, ahead of crunch White House talks on the future of the Arctic island which President Donald Trump has repeatedly threatened. FRANCE 24's Emerald Maxwell reports.

events.title: Iranian regime targeting Starlink users in bid to squash leaking protest footage
events.description: Iran's internet blockade fails to stop protest footage leaks via Starlink as authorities reportedly kill at least 646 demonstrators in ongoing crackdown.

events.title: Canada's Mark Carney faces delicate balancing act in China visit
events.description: The PM is seeking to deepen trade and repair ties with China after years of tense relations - without compromising national security or provoking the US.

events.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
events.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

events.title: 'Very little evidence of mass organisation by protesters' to take over Iran government, analyst says
events.description: Speaking with FRANCE 24's Sharon Gaffney, Arang Keshavarzian, Author and Professor of Middle Eastern and Islamic Studies at New York University, says that "there's so few good options for Iranians at this current juncture that [Reza Pahlavi] is the only concrete name that can come to the fore", adding that "important democratic figures in Iran don't have the organisational capacity to come together to build a big coalition".

events.title: Marine Le Pen's appeal: Will trial torpedo French far-right leader's presidential hopes?
events.description: A big stress test for the West's rules-based order, or will French judges take it all in their stride? It's the opening day of Marine Le Pen's appeal against a corruption conviction that for now bars the far-right frontrunner from the 2027 presidential race. With the verdict expected in July, that's getting awfully close to Election Day next spring. The National Rally politician and her supporters have branded the case lawfare – a political vendetta.

events.title: Ugandan opposition leader campaigns in flak jacket
events.description: The Ugandan opposition leader known as Bobi Wine has been campaigning for president in a flak jacket and helmet as soldiers filled the streets of the capital, Kampala

events.title: China had a record $1.2 trillion trade surplus in 2025, as exports rose 6.6% in December
events.description: China has reported its trade surplus surged to a record of almost $1.2 trillion last year as exports to other countries made up for slowing shipments to the United States

events.title: Built on care and connection: How one Somali-British woman is strengthening diaspora communities
events.description: When her family moved from Somalia to London in the 1980s, Safia Jama watched women in her community help her mother navigate a new life in the UK — booking doctor’s appointments, enrolling children in school, and learning how to access everyday services in a new country.

events.title: LA County eyes 'ICE-free zones' on government property despite $1B in federal funding at risk
events.description: Los Angeles County considers creating "ICE-free zones" to block federal immigration enforcement operations, risking over $1 billion in federal funding.

events.title: Affluent Virginia suburb rocked as trial begins for ex-federal agent husband in nanny love-triangle murders
events.description: Former IRS agent accused of orchestrating double murder with Brazilian au pair to hide affair. Trial begins in shocking Virginia criminal case.

events.title: Greenland's prime minister says 'we choose Denmark' over the US
events.description: Greenland's prime minister said if his territory had to choose between the United States and Denmark, it would choose Denmark, a report said.

events.title: A Dubai chocolate-inspired dessert has taken S Korea by storm
events.description: Shops are selling hundreds of cookies within minutes as the frenzy sends prices of ingredients surging.

events.title: What message do Greenlanders have for Trump?
events.description: The BBC's Europe editor Katya Adler hears from Greenlanders, whose island is embroiled in a geopolitical storm.

events.title: Iran accuses foreign intelligence behind protest movement
events.description: Israel's covert operations in Iran spark allegations of destabilising protests as tensions escalate.

events.title: Trump says ‘help is on the way’ for Iran protesters
events.description: US President Donald Trump has said “help is on the way” for anti-government protesters in Iran.

events.title: Are Iran’s protests different this time around?
events.description: The unprecedented convergence of internal and external pressures makes these protests distinct.

events.title: Vance to meet Danish and Greenlandic officials in Washington on Wednesday
events.description: U.S. Vice President JD Vance will meet Denmark's foreign minister and his Greenlandic counterpart in Washington on Wednesday to discuss the Arctic island, at the center of a geopolitical storm.

events.title: As Iran's protests continue, Israelis and Palestinians watch closely
events.description: There is broad support for the protests among Israeli officials, but Palestinians say they hope the Iranian regime stays in place and the protests die down soon.

events.title: US' JD Vance to host Greenland talks amid takeover threats
events.description: The foreign ministers of Denmark and Greenland are hoping to defuse tensions over the Arctic island in Washington talks. US President Donald Trump has doubled down on threats to seize the autonomous Danish territory.

events.title: Contempt threat after Clintons refuse Epstein testimony
events.description: Bill and Hillary Clinton have refused to comply with a Congressional subpoena to testify in a Jeffrey Epstein probe and could face contempt charges.

events.title: France to open consulate in Greenland in a ‘political signal’ amid Trump threats
events.description: ‍French Foreign Minister Jean-Noël Barrot on Wednesday said France will ​open a consulate in ⁠Greenland on February 6, acting on a decision taken last year during President Emmanuel Macron's visit to the autonomous Danish territory. The "political signal" to "be more present" in Greenland comes as President Donald Trump threatens a takeover of the Arctic region.

events.title: X replaces Iran’s flag emoji to historic Lion and Sun flag in support of protests
events.description: Elon Musk’s social media platform X changed its Iranian flag emoji, from the current Islamic Republic flag - featuring a red emblem - to the historic pre-Revolution Lion and Sun symbol widely used by protesters of the regime. In Truth or Fake, Vedika Bahl goes through how this came to be, the online reactions, and how useful this could realistically be on the ground.

events.title: DOJ says 'no basis' for civil rights investigation into Minneapolis ICE officer killing
events.description: The DOJ declined a civil rights probe into an ICE officer's killing of Renee Good in Minneapolis, breaking from past practices as the FBI investigation continues.

events.title: Tennessee Highway Patrol debunks viral claims protester was struck by trooper's vehicle
events.description: Dashcam video reveals a Tennessee Highway Patrol trooper's encounter with a Memphis protester who appeared to fake being hit, debunking viral claims.

events.title: Venezuela has freed some American citizens from prison, US official says
events.description: A US state department official did not confirm the identities or number of prisoners released, but called the move "an important step in the right direction".

events.title: Venezuela’s top lawmaker says more than 400 prisoners have been released
events.description: The announcement contradicts claims from local rights groups that no more than 70 prisoners have been freed.

events.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
events.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

events.title: Minnesota sues over Trump's ICE enforcement. And, SCOTUS hears trans athlete cases
events.description: Minnesota officials sued the Trump administration over unconstitutional ICE conduct. And, SCOTUS hears two cases on whether states can bar transgender athletes from women's sports.

events.title: US lauds freeing of American prisoners in Venezuela
events.description: The US State Department hailed Venezuela's interim government for releasing American prisoners, calling it a "step in the right direction."

events.title: The UK is expected to approve a 'mega' Chinese embassy in London despite objections
events.description: Britain’s government is expected to approve a large Chinese embassy near London’s financial district

events.title: Venezuela: UN independent investigators call for immediate release of all political prisoners
events.description: More than 100 political prisoners have been released in Venezuela, the Government announced on Monday, just over a week after the seizure and rendition of President Nicolás Maduro in Caracas by the United States.

events.title: As Iran weakens, questions grow over Mohammed bin Salman’s regional ambitions
events.description: Saudi Arabia asserts bold foreign policy as Iran weakens, reshaping Middle East power dynamics through strategic partnerships and regional realignments.

events.title: Look of the Week: Blackpink headline Coachella in Korean hanboks
events.description: Bringing the second day of this year's Coachella to a close, K-Pop girl group Blackpink made history Saturday night when they became the first Asian act to ever headline the festival. To a crowd of, reportedly, over 125,000 people, Jennie, Jisoo, Lisa and Rosé used the ground-breaking moment to pay homage to Korean heritage by arriving onstage in hanboks: a traditional type of dress.

events.title: How Playboy cut ties with Hugh Hefner to create a post-MeToo brand
events.description: Hugh Hefner launched Playboy Magazine 70 years ago this year. The first issue included a nude photograph of Marilyn Monroe, which he had purchased and published without her knowledge or consent.

events.title: Wes Streeting asks US expert Jonathan Haidt to address officials on social media ban for under-16s
events.description: Exclusive: Health secretary issues invitation in push for UK to consider copying landmark restrictions in Australia Wes Streeting has asked Jonathan Haidt, a bestselling author and high-profile advocate of banning social media for under-16s, to speak to his officials in his push for the UK to consider following a landmark ban in Australia. The health secretary has invited Haidt to address an event with staff, charities and MPs after the prime minister, Keir Starmer, said he was open to stricter limits for young people. Continue reading...

events.title: Costa Rica's security director says plot to assassinate president uncovered
events.description: Costa Rican security officials have reported an alleged plot to assassinate President Rodrigo Chaves

events.title: ‘Beyond GDP’ economists push for clearer metrics on wellbeing, sustainability
events.description: Top finance experts are meeting at UN Geneva this week to push for a radical shake up in the way economic growth is gauged, in response to concerns that GDP measurements provide little insight about progress on key sustainability targets that are vital to our survival.

events.title: Students for Life report finds massive uptick in Christian colleges' support for abortion, Planned Parenthood
events.description: Abortion support among Christian colleges has reportedly surged 38% since Roe v. Wade was overturned, with one in seven now connected to abortion.

events.title: Secret room to be built at Chinese embassy near cable lines, sparking widespread espionage fears
events.description: Unredacted plans for China's new London embassy reveal secret underground chamber near cables, sparking espionage concerns among UK security experts.

events.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
events.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

events.title: Vance to meet Danish and Greenlandic officials in Washington as locals say Greenland is not for sale
events.description: U.S. Vice President JD Vance is meeting with Danish and Greenlandic officials in Washington on Wednesday as President Donald Trump insists on controlling Greenland

events.title: Rio de Janeiro zoo animals treated to popsicles as city faces scorching weather
events.description: Animals at Rio de Janeiro’s BioParque zoo received popsicles and frozen treats Tuesday as the city faced another day of extreme heat during Brazil’s summer

events.title: Mexico arrests 6 alleged Tren de Aragua gang members
events.description: Mexican authorities have arrested six alleged members of the Tren de Aragua gang in Mexico City for crimes related to drug trafficking, extortion, and human trafficking

events.title: Ex-congressional IT aide accused of stealing 240 government phones and selling them at pawn shop
events.description: A former congressional IT aide is accused of stealing 240 taxpayer-funded cellphones worth $150K, shipping them to his home and then selling most at a local pawn shop.

events.title: Greenlanders brace for summit that could shape the Arctic's future - and their own
events.description: US Vice President JD Vance will host Danish and Greenlandic foreign ministers for talks on Wednesday.

events.title: Claudette Colvin, US civil rights pioneer, dies at 86
events.description: Colvin was arrested for refusing to give up her bus seat to a white person months before the famous case of Rosa Parks.

events.title: K-pop drum duet between Japan and South Korea's leaders caps off summit talks
events.description: Leaders of the two East Asian nations played drums to hits from BTS and KPop Demon Hunters.

events.title: Actor Kiefer Sutherland arrested over alleged assault of ride-share driver
events.description: Investigators arrested the actor, star of 24 and Designated Survivor, in Hollywood early on Monday morning.

events.title: Mortuary videos show how deadly Iran crackdown has become
events.description: BBC Verify has been examining disturbing footage from a mortuary in Tehran, showing scores of bodies. These images could hold clues about what’s happening inside Iran.

events.title: Watch: Moment skier and dog swept along by avalanche
events.description: Footage recorded by Spanish skier Ares Masip shows the incident on Pic de l'Hortell, a mountain in Andorra.

events.title: UK actor Juliet Stevenson campaigns for mothers in Gaza
events.description: UK actor Juliet Stevenson is one of many renowned female artists who are pleading for more help for mothers in Gaza.

events.title: Far-right pro-Israel group Betar US to end activity in New York: NY AG says
events.description: Attorney General says Betar US engaged in 'widespread persecution' of Muslim, Arab, Palestinian, and Jewish New Yorkers.

events.title: Juliet Stevenson on Gaza: ‘I’m disappointed by the silence in my industry’
events.description: Al Jazeera interviews the veteran theatre, film and television actor, one of Britain's leading voices for Palestinians.

events.title: Chinese app ‘Are You Dead?’ to change name after surge in popularity
events.description: The app, aimed at people with a ‘solitary lifestyle’, has gone viral in China.

events.title: Africa Cup of Nations: Semi-finals
events.description: We’re at the semi-final stage at the Africa Cup of Nations, where the margins are tighter and the pressure is growing.

events.title: North Korea’s Kim Yo Jong says no chance of improved ties with the South
events.description: Powerful sister of North Korean leader Kim Jong Un rebukes claims she is open to more "communication".

events.title: Aubameyang returns as Gabon lifts team’s suspension after AFCON exit
events.description: Star players Aubameyang and Manga are back but the football association will continue its search for a new head coach.

events.title: Analysis: Why Greenland and Europe might have to offer Trump concessions
events.description: Europe might offer a minerals deal and greater US security presence on Greenland. Will that be enough to satiate Trump?

events.title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
events.description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

events.title: Analysis: Fox News is about to enter the true No Spin Zone
events.description: This is it.

events.title: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings
events.description: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

events.title: 'A definitive backslide.' Inside fashion's worrying runway trend
events.description: Now that the Fall-Winter 2023 catwalks have been disassembled, it's clear one trend was more pervasive than any collective penchant for ruffles, pleated skirts or tailored coats.

events.title: Michael Jordan's 1998 NBA Finals sneakers sell for a record $2.2 million
events.description: In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship — and now they are the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction. The game-winning sneakers sold for $2.2 million at Sotheby's in New York on Tuesday, smashing the sneaker auction record of $1.47 million, set in 2021 by a pair of Nike Air Ships that Jordan wore earlier in his career.

events.title: Here's the real reason to turn on airplane mode when you fly
events.description: We all know the routine by heart: "Please ensure your seats are in the upright position, tray tables stowed, window shades are up, laptops are stored in the overhead bins and electronic devices are set to flight mode."

events.title: 'I was up to my waist down a hippo's throat.' He survived, and here's his advice
events.description: Paul Templer was living his best life.

events.title: Relaxed entry rules make it easier than ever to visit this stunning Asian nation
events.description: Due to its remoteness and short summer season, Mongolia has long been a destination overlooked by travelers.

events.title: The most beautiful sections of China's Great Wall
events.description: Having lived in Beijing for almost 12 years, I've had plenty of time to travel widely in China.

events.title: Sign up to our newsletter for a weekly roundup of travel news
events.description: No description available.

events.title: M 6.4 - 245 km NNW of Tobelo, Indonesia
events.description: PAGER - GREEN ShakeMap - VI DYFI? - IV Time 2026-01-10 14:58:23 UTC 2026-01-10 14:58:23 UTC at epicenter Location 3.701°N 126.987°E Depth 31.00 km (19.26 mi)

events.title: China's trade surplus surges 20% to a record $1.2 trillion, even with Trump's tariffs
events.description: China's trade surplus surged to a record of almost $1.2 trillion in 2025, the government said Wednesday, as exports to other countries made up for slowing shipments to the U.S. under President Donald Trump's onslaught of higher tariffs.

events.title: US civil rights icon Claudette Colvin dies, aged 86
events.description: Claudette Colvin's refusal to give up her seat on a segregated bus in Alabama in 1955 was a key moment in the US civil rights movement. "History had me glued to that seat," she later said.

events.title: China logs record trade surplus in 2025 amid Trump tariffs
events.description: China's trade has reached a "new historical high" in 2025 and Beijing plans to 'open more' in 2026 as Trump's tariffs force producers to push their products in alternative markets.

events.title: Should EU leaders sit on Trump's 'Board of Peace' for Gaza?
events.description: The next phase of the US-sponsored Gaza peace plan involves setting up a "Board of Peace." Trump wants to chair it and, even though it's been heavily criticized, Europeans also want a seat.

events.title: Uganda: Crackdown, internet blackout ahead of vote
events.description: Uganda's authorities have shut down rights groups, arrested opponents and their supporters, now they've turned off the internet. After 40 years in office, President Yoweri Museveni has no intention of stepping down now.

events.title: Japan, South Korea vow stronger ties amid China challenge
events.description: Japan and South Korea are seeking to strengthen cooperation amid growing geopolitical risks and Tokyo’s worsening relations with Beijing.

events.title: Will Trump risk a clash with China over Iran tariff?
events.description: Donald Trump's sudden 25% tariff on nations trading with Iran puts Beijing squarely in the spotlight. China knows how to evade sanctions and has the muscle to retaliate. DW explores what this showdown could mean.

events.title: Venezuelans regain access to X, a year after Maduro blocked network
events.description: Access to X was restored in Venezuela on Tuesday, more than a year after Nicoalas Maduro blocked access to Elon Musk's social network. While interim president Delcy Rodriguez's updated profile called for unity, Maduro's X account featured a post asking for his return from the US, where he is facing drug trafficking charges.

events.title: Acclaimed French-Iranian photojournalist asks Macron to ‘take action’ against Iranian regime
events.description: Acclaimed French-Iranian photojournalist Reza Deghati addressed an open letter to President Emmanuel Macron earlier this week calling on the French leader to respond to the events unfolding in Iran. In an interview with FRANCE 24, Deghati said France has a historical “mission” to defend human rights.

events.title: French Cup: Marseille thrash Bayeux (9-0) and will face Rennes
events.description: Olympique de Marseille easily defeated Bayeux (9-0) in the French Cup round of 32. They will face Rennes in the round of 16.

events.title: Venezuela frees several Americans from prison, US official says
events.description: Venezuela on Tuesday began freeing jailed Americans, a US official said, praising the interim leadership after Washington’s ouster of ex-president Nicolas Maduro. The official gave no immediate details on how many were freed or their identities, only that more than one American detainee had been released.

events.title: US civil rights pioneer Claudette Colvin dies at 86
events.description: Claudette Colvin, who refused to give up her seat on a segregated Alabama bus in 1955, months before Rosa Parks, has died aged 86, her foundation said on Tuesday. Colvin was 15 at the time. Her foundation said she left a legacy of courage that helped change American history.

events.title: Uganda shuts down internet ahead of election
events.description: In tonight's edition: A week after Ugandan authorities denied plans to shut down internet access during this week's presidential election, public online access is blocked for millions of voters. Also, Ghana gains over 500 new citizens as the latest eager cohort of diasporic visitors celebrate their heritage in a naturalisation ceremony in Accra. And in Senegal, fans of the Lions of Teranga are gearing up for Wednesday's AFCON semi-final against Egypt, not least when it comes to selling merchandise.

events.title: Australian author charged over child exploitation material
events.description: Australian author Craig Silvey has been charged with possessing and distributing child exploitation material.

events.title: Airports close and flights disrupted as freezing rain and snow hits Europe
events.description: Airports were forced to close and flights were disrupted in parts of Europe due to icy weather.

events.title: The UK is watering down plans for mandatory digital ID cards after a backlash
events.description: The British government has scaled back plans for mandatory digital ID cards, initially proposed as a way of helping control immigration

events.title: Ugandan voters face soldiers in the street and internet shutdown before election
events.description: Ugandans are set to vote in an election for president and other leaders

events.title: A construction crane falls on a passenger train in northeastern Thailand, killing at least 12 people
events.description: A construction crane has fallen on a passenger train in northeastern Thailand, killing at least 12 people

events.title: Construction crane falls on passenger train, kills 4
events.description: A construction crane falls on a passenger train in northeastern Thailand, killing at least 4

events.title: Japanese and South Korean leaders jam to K-pop hits at a summit
events.description: The Japanese and South Korean leaders agreed to deepen cooperation between their countries before they let loose with their own surprise cultural exchange in a surprise jam session drumming to K-pop hits

events.title: Puerto Rico announces compulsory visits to assess conditions in housing projects
events.description: Puerto Rico is announcing compulsory visits to the island’s 328 public housing projects to check on residents and their living conditions

events.title: Amidst uncertainty, a helpline in Pakistan becomes a lifeline for Afghans
events.description: They ask heartbreaking questions: “What will happen to us?” “Is it true they will deport us?” “We don’t want to go back. How can I live in Afghanistan?” The words of Sumaiya, who staffs a helpline for refugees and asylum-seekers living in Pakistan but facing the eventuality of having to return to neighbouring Afghanistan.

events.title: Family 'quickly believed' surgeon ex was involved in Ohio dentist couple's murder as co-worker details mishaps
events.description: Ex-husband of Ohio dentist allegedly kills her and new spouse in Columbus. Michael McKee charged with premeditated murder of Monique and Spencer Tepe.

events.title: Mississippi synagogue arson suspect's dad turns him in after laughing confession, FBI says
events.description: A man accused of a Mississippi synagogue arson confessed to his father, saying he "finally got them," the FBI said. Stephen Pittman faces charges.

events.title: Supreme Court hears arguments over trans athletes in girls' sports and more top headlines
events.description: Get all the stories you need-to-know from the most powerful name in news delivered first thing every morning to your inbox.

events.title: Former US Navy sailor learns sentence for spying for China
events.description: Former Navy sailor Jinchao Wei sentenced to 200 months in prison for selling classified military secrets to Chinese intelligence officer for $12,000.

events.title: Minnesota sues Trump admin over sweeping immigration raids in Twin Cities
events.description: Minnesota sues Trump administration over alleged militarized immigration raids in Twin Cities, naming DHS Secretary Kristi Noem and ICE officials.

events.title: Passengers baffled and confused after screams burst from beneath taxiing Air Canada plane
events.description: Passengers aboard a taxiing Air Canada flight were left shaken after muffled screams and banging were suddenly heard from beneath the cabin.
